result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Lenon Charles Terry

records.addlTxt: Upon the request of the parties, Court rescheduled plea and sentencing to November 11, 2022 at 10 AM in Branch 11, Rm 608 CH.
Received and Filed: Stipulation for New Court Date
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for September 23, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Case cannot be heard on June 9, 2022 as court will not be in session.
Deputy clerk in contact with the parties via electronic mail.
Case is adjourned for plea/sentencing in Branch 28 on September 23, 2022.

Per Chief Judge Directive 22-04 effective July 30, 2022, this calendar will be assigned to Judge David Swanson, Branch 11 in Room 316 of the Safety Bldg.

Attorney Russell J. A. Jones in court, defendant Lenon Charles Terry not in court, in custody.  Patrick J Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for scheduling conference.  The matter was held OFF THE RECORD.  Defense requested a Plea and sentencing date.  The matter is adjourned back to Branch 28.
  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for June 9, 2022 at 10:00 am.

Defense counsel requests adjournment to the morning of March 4, 2022.

Clerk:  jms

Defendant Lenon Charles Terry in court with Attorney Russell J. A. Jones.  Defendant Lenon Charles Terry in custody.  John Daniel Flynn appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  PARTIES APPEAR BY VIDEO.
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed.  Court found probable cause and bound Defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Sanders, Branch 28.   Original Information received and filed.  Copy given to Defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant was arraigned in open court and pled not guilty. Court ordered case adjourned for Scheduling Conference in Branch 28.  Scheduling conference scheduled for March 4, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Lenon Charles Terry in court with attorney Angel L Johnson.  Defendant Lenon Charles Terry in custody.  Karine O'Byrne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Lenon Charles Terry appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Sanders, Branch 28.   AS TO COUNT 2:  Motion to dismiss by defense for lack of probable cause argued and DENIED by the Court.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.
